file_content.text: The guns are destroyed.
We're slicing the Republic's computers now. Let's see what they're doing out there in the cold.
Ah, Master Kaedan's killer. He was a good man and will be sorely missed.
Ah, Master Kaedan's killers. He was a good man and will be sorely missed.
But killing one great man is never enough. The Republic has always thrived on the effort of its united citizens.
Lieutenant, input the coordinates of the Imperial base into the ELX-25 and fire when ready. Give my regards to Moff Regus.
Blast! The ELX-25 was only supposed to be in planning stages! If it's operational, it could obliterate our base with a single shot.
Then we'd better work quickly. Get me the coordinates and I'll destroy it.
Not on my watch.
We're tracing the admiral's signal now.
Wait. What's the ELX-25?
ELX-25?
An experimental long-range cannon. Supposedly years from completion, but the Republic must've built a prototype. Sounds like we're the test.
How did the Republic get this kind of weapon without us knowing?
This reeks of incompetence.
Imperial Intelligence is dissolved. Our information is spotty at best.
We have to improvise. Based on estimates of the ELX-25's range and the origin of the admiral's transmission, it should be at these coordinates.
We have limited time, and you're closest. Destroy that weapon.
That sounds an awful lot like an order.
Watch your tone.
I'm sorry, I don't have time for formalities. We have to stop the Republic attack.
I'm on my way.
Sometimes you need to adapt to survive.
I'm good at improvising.
I hope the admiral's still around when I get there.
I'll kill that admiral.
Me, too. The Republic will answer for this.
Destroy the ELX-25, or we'll have no choice but to retreat from Ilum.
Ambush! It was a trap. The Republic were waiting for us at the shield generators. We're under heavy fire. I don't know how long we can--
Did you hear that? Somebody's played us for fools.
The Republic artillery base is protected by a huge ray shield. We can't destroy the anti-air guns until that ray shield is down.
It looks like you have a new mission: Destroy the shield generators and then attack the Republic artillery base and take out the guns.
I'll take care of the shield generators; you find out who betrayed us. I don't like being taken for a fool.
I don't like being set up.
You're not the fool. I am. It was my plan, and I will find the traitor.
This won't be the first time I've had to improvise.
I can think on my toes.
The consummate professional.
Guess I gotta clean up your mess again.
Is that all the plan you got?
Just make the explosions nice and loud.
I will destroy the shield generators and bury the Republic under the wreckage of their artillery.
Someone will pay for this.
Kill a few for me, will you?
Shield generators, then guns. Got it.
Understood.
Good. We can't do anything with that ray shield up.
The Empire might save itself the expense of an army and just hire me next time.
More work for me, then.
We don't have time to scramble another squad to the generators.
Remember, you won't be able to reach the Republic's artillery until the ray shield is down. Take out the shield generators and then destroy the guns.
Contact me at the Republic base once both the shield generators and the guns are destroyed. My men will move in and clean up.
You're pathetic, Moff.
